intro: Pseudopodospermum chantavicum, commonly known as the Madagascar starleaf, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its fruits are follicles that contain several seeds, and it is adapted to thrive in the tropical and subtropical climates of its native region. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
